page.title: 11VILLAGE BUSINESSES 2
page.content: There is a saddlery in Black Torrington. The saddler begins with a wooden frame called a tree. He covers it with webbing and hessian. He stretches a sheet of leather over it and nails it underneath. He cuts out flaps and skirts from hard butt leather and fixes them to the tree. He makes a leather panel, stuffs it with flock and stitches it underneath the tree. He also makes bridles and reins and repairs other leather goods. There are two builders in the village. They undertake all types of work. One employs a carpenter, 2 masons, a decorator and a labourer, and the other just a mason and an apprentice. One obtains his raw materials from Tamar Trading in Holsworthy and the other from Rawle, Gammon and Baker in Bideford. They both use vans for transport of men and materials.
